body.p: To create a BPEL Workflow open WSO2 Developer Studio Dashboard and select BPEL Workflow from Business Process Server category.
There are two ways to create a BPEL artifact.

If you choose New BPEL Workflow option, and click Next, you will have to fill information like Project Name, Process Name, Process Namespace etc. By default, Process Name will be automatically filled as the name you entered for the Project Name. You can change the Process Name later if you need.
Give the necessary information and click Finish.Now you will see the BPEL Workflow has been created in the workspace and you can define the BPEL Process by simple drag and drop.
With Import BPEL Workflow option, you can import a BPEL workflow which is saved in the Zip format, from the file system. Browse for the BPEL Zip file and click Finish.
Now you will see content of the archive file has been extracted and a BPEL Workflow has been created in the workspace.

Once you are done with editing the BPEL Process, you can create a Deployable Archive and deploy it to WSO2 Business Process Server. You can create BPEL Archive file by right click on the BPEL Workflow that you have created and select Export Project as Deployable Archive.
Give the location where you want to save the archive file and click Finish.

As another option, you can group the BPEL Workflow that you have created in to a Carbon Application Project and create a Carbon Application Archive [CAR] and deploy in to WSO2 Business Process Server.
